title: Bug 269522[handles] Cross reference view and markers mix up joinpoints assigned to advice
description: Bug 269522[handles] Cross reference view and markers mix up joinpoints assigned to advice
OB: When selecting one of the after advice statements in the cross reference view, all joinpoints for both after advice statements are displayed. However, when selecting the other after advice statement, no joinpoints are shown. When right-clicking on the marker for either piece of after advice, all joinpoints for both pieces of advice are displayed.
EB: When selecting one of the after advice statements in the cross reference view, only the joinpoints for that specific advice statement should be displayed. Right-clicking on the marker for a specific advice statement should also only show the joinpoints assigned to that advice.
SR:
1. Open and perform a clean compile on the attached project. 
2. Open the cross reference view. 
3. Select line 22 and note that you see 3 joinpoints (should only be 3). 
4. Select line 68 and note that you see 0 joinpoints (should be 2 here). 
5. Right-click the marker at line 68 and choose 'advises'. Make sure you only see the joinpoints assigned to the advice at line 68. 
6. Right-click the marker at line 22 and choose 'advises'. Make sure you only see the joinpoints assigned to the advice at line 22.
